Experience Academic Counselor, College of Science California State University, East Bay 2014  – Present (1 year) Recruitment and Alumni Relations Administrator Stanford University School of Medicine September 2013  –  August 2014  (1 year) Medicine Residency/ Educational Programs • Manage Intern residents recruitment selection process (~380 applicants) and plan activities for potential residents each year for the largest department in the School of Medicine; serve as point-of-contact for inquiries from potential applicants 
•	Develop and maintain resident trainee’s database, training verifications; organize educational conferences, Manage Mentor program, and program events (Retreat, Intern Orientation week, Match Day, Graduation Banquet).  
•	Produce statistics on recruitment for Program Directors and Department Leadership, develop and maintain alumni database and communication, including newsletters, social network, mass mailings, and other communication collaterals; coordinate alumni events. Manage program requirements for (~125 residents) working in collaboration with Program Directors, Chiefs, residents, faculty, and clinic staff. Research Administrator Stanford University School of Medicine 2007  –  September 2013  (6 years) Stanford, CA •	Research administration support for MR research Manager of Radiological Sciences Laboratory coordinating research studies scheduling for faculty, researchers, Post-doctorate, Graduate and Undergraduate students. 
•	Regularly organize meetings, classroom trainings, seminars, and educational events 
•	Manage and maintain research database of student research scans ensuring operations are administered efficiently and in compliance with the University rules and regulations. Prepare, verify, and execute required documentation maintaining confidentiality, track correspondence and serve as a liaison between the PI, Stanford Hospital, and other central departments in the University.

 Experience Research Administrator Stanford University Department of Geophysics June 2015  – Present (3 months) Stanford, California Provide day-to-day management and oversight of grants and contracts to ensure that account activity adheres to the regulations set forth by the sponsor and the university. Prepare financial reports and reconcile expenses. Meet with PI’s on a regular basis to discuss status of accounts; generate projections and analyze payroll distribution. Collaborate with the Office of Sponsored Research regarding account set-up, requests to carry forward funds, no cost time extensions and close-out activities. Prepare budgets for proposals in response to published funding opportunities. 
 Research Process Manager Stanford University Medical Center December 2011  –  June 2015  (3 years 7 months) Palo Alto, CA Serve as primary point of contact and technical resource for faculty members in the Department of Pathology and the Genome Center; provide strategic advice, establish timelines and monitor progress. Manage the proposal development and submission process; ensure sponsor requirements are met and University policies are followed. Develop complex budgets; provide Institutional review and oversight. Submit grants and accept awards on behalf of the University. 
Work in close collaboration new and seasoned staff members, verify compliance with federal and Institutional regulations, resolve issues as they arise with regard to post award finance, keep stakeholders informed and maintain back-up documentation for auditing purposes. Provide expert consultation with regard to proper account set-up and post-award activities including requests for no cost extensions, carry-forward, submission of Just-In-Time (JIT) materials, progress reports and re-budgeting. Extensive use of database and variety of electronic submission systems. 
 Sr. Grant and Contract Specialist The University of Texas Health Science Center at Houston 2009  –  2011  (2 years) Houston, Texas Assisted faculty members in the Department of Biostatistics with pre and post award grant and contract activities. Communicated complex concepts to faculty and staff to ensure compliance with federal law, Institutional policy and sponsor requirements. Served as technical resource to the research community; led training seminars. Developed budgets and reviewed final applications for completion and accuracy. Met internal and external deadlines in collaboration with multiple Institutions and across several University departments. Evaluated expenditures and advised research community regarding budgetary issues including cost sharing, salary calculations, effort reporting, application of indirect cost rates, patient care expenses and subcontract activity. Handled grant transfers and monitored post award subcontract activity. 
 Associate Director, Pre-Award | Office of Sponsored Projects Florida Atlantic University 2005  –  2009  (4 years) Boca Raton, FL Oversaw day-to-day operations of the pre-award sponsored research office. Assisted faculty in the development of competitive, complete and accurate grant proposals to obtain federal, state, county and Foundation research funding. Analyzed terms and conditions, negotiated and signed contracts and subcontract agreements on behalf of the University in conjunction with in-house Counsel. Led the charge to establish and document a process to comply with export control regulations. Attended state-wide Director’s meetings, national FDP and NCURA meetings and participated in the analysis of complex emerging issues such as effort reporting. Developed training curriculum and held workshops for faculty and staff. Advised researchers regarding budgetary issues such as cost sharing, indirect cost calculations and served as liaison to post award finance, the Office of Research Integrity, Technology Transfer under the general direction of the VP for Research. 
 Project Coordinator, Clinical Operations Corcept Therapeutics 2001  –  2004  (3 years) Menlo Park, CA Helped to facilitate multi-site Phase II and Phase III clinical trials. 
Negotiated contracts with clinical research organizations (CRO’s), hospitals and academic medical centers in conjunction with legal counsel. Handled the logistics of just-in-time drug delivery. Served as primary liaison to attorneys, consulting pharmacists, site monitors, physicians and nurses to ensure steady and consistent enrollment. 
Maintained detailed documentation and SOP’s to ensure FDA compliance. Reviewed consent forms, case report forms for consistency with protocols and schedule of events. 
 Sr. Research Administrator Stanford University School of Medicine 1987  –  1999  (12 years) Stanford, CA Provided financial management and oversight of grants, contracts and unrestricted accounts; reviewed and approved expenditures and met with faculty to discuss forecasting and labor distribution. Provided day-to-day support to 50-100 faculty, post docs, graduate students and staff. Led new employee orientation and served as liaison to central administration. Coordinated multi-site research consortium and provided high level administrative support to the Department Chair

 Languages English English English Education University of San Francisco MPA,  Health Services 1999  – 2001 The University of San Francisco is accredited by NASPAA, the foremost membership organization of graduate programs in public administration, public policy, public affairs, and public & nonprofit management. The concentration in Health Care Services prepared me for a career as an administrator in academic medical centers. l gained a thorough understanding of the dynamics affecting various healthcare delivery systems, as well as the complexities of the role of the state in public health, from both legal and ethical perspectives.
